 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Apr 10, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Apr 10, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A URL responding with a server-side redirect to an external protocol can trigger an external protocol dialog with a spoofed origin. The origin is never the redirecting URL's origin. Instead, the initiating page's origin (or precursor origin if opaque) is shown in dialogs. This affects both application protocols (e.g. ms-calculator:) and the telephone protocol (tel:). The UI for these are different, but the effects are similar in most cases.<span class="line"><!---->A URL responding with a server-side redirect to an external protocol can trigger an external protocol dialog with a spoofed origin. The origin is never the redirecting URL's origin. Instead, the initiating page's origin (or precursor origin if opaque) is shown in dialogs. This affects both application protocols (e.g. ms-calculator:) and the telephone protocol (tel:). The UI for these are different, but the effects are similar in most cases.<!----></span><br><br>For example, if a page on <span class="line"><!---->For example, if a page on <!----></span>https://www.google[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google[.]com"><!---->https://www.google[.]com<!----></a> contains a link (<a href="...">) to <span class="line"><!----> contains a link (&lt;a href="..."&gt;) to <!----></span>https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker[.]tld/redirect"><!---->https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> and a user clicks the link, the dialog will show <span class="line"><!----> and a user clicks the link, the dialog will show <!----></span>https://www.google[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google[.]com"><!---->https://www.google[.]com<!----></a> as the origin instead of <span class="line"><!----> as the origin instead of <!----></span>https://attacker[.]tld<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker[.]tld"><!---->https://attacker[.]tld<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><br><br>Similarly, if a page on <span class="line"><!---->Similarly, if a page on <!----></span>https://www.google[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google[.]com"><!---->https://www.google[.]com<!----></a> navigates the current window or new window via JavaScript (window.location or window.open()) to <span class="line"><!----> navigates the current window or new window via JavaScript (window.location or window.open()) to <!----></span>https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker[.]tld/redirect"><!---->https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the dialog will show <span class="line"><!----> the dialog will show <!----></span>https://www.google[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google[.]com"><!---->https://www.google[.]com<!----></a> as the origin.<span class="line"><!----> as the origin.<!----></span><br><br>In effect, the behavior is the same as if the page had directly used the external protocol URL (ms-calculator:) instead of the HTTPS URL (<span class="line"><!---->In effect, the behavior is the same as if the page had directly used the external protocol URL (ms-calculator:) instead of the HTTPS URL (<!----></span>https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker[.]tld/redirect"><!---->https://attacker[.]tld/redirect<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>As far as I can tell, common protections such as CSP and iframe sandboxing are bypassed in most scenarios.<span class="line"><!---->As far as I can tell, common protections such as CSP and iframe sandboxing are bypassed in most scenarios.<!----></span><br><br>No user interaction is needed if a user previously checked "Always allow {origin} to open links of this type..." for the target origin and protocol, or if allowed for origin+protocol via enterprise policy: <span class="line"><!---->No user interaction is needed if a user previously checked "Always allow {origin} to open links of this type..." for the target origin and protocol, or if allowed for origin+protocol via enterprise policy: <!----></span>https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins"><!---->https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins<!----></a><br><br>ADDITIONAL INFO<span class="line"><!---->ADDITIONAL INFO<!----></span><br>A malicious URL could be placed in search result pages, "external link" interstitial pages, user-provided URLs in content, among many other scenarios. Most websites filter input to only allow http(s) URLs (generally to avoid javascript: URLs which are blocked by browser in server-side redirects), therefore this works as an effective bypass to spoof the origin across most websites and navigation methods.<span class="line"><!---->A malicious URL could be placed in search result pages, "external link" interstitial pages, user-provided URLs in content, among many other scenarios. Most websites filter input to only allow http(s) URLs (generally to avoid javascript: URLs which are blocked by browser in server-side redirects), therefore this works as an effective bypass to spoof the origin across most websites and navigation methods.<!----></span><br><br>See attached video spoof-google-search.mp4 for Google Search demo with both calc and tel PoCs. Note that I only enabled this PoC to work from my IP address for a few minutes to record the video.<span class="line"><!---->See attached video spoof-google-search.mp4 for Google Search demo with both calc and tel PoCs. Note that I only enabled this PoC to work from my IP address for a few minutes to record the video.<!----></span><br><br>External protocols in server-side redirects probably should be treated similarly to javascript: URLs in server-side redirects, which are blocked by the browser as unsafe. Otherwise, the browser could render a blank page with origin set to the server-side redirect initiator, to ensure the dialog and address bar show the correct origin and the tab doesn't have another origin's content rendered.<span class="line"><!---->External protocols in server-side redirects probably should be treated similarly to javascript: URLs in server-side redirects, which are blocked by the browser as unsafe. Otherwise, the browser could render a blank page with origin set to the server-side redirect initiator, to ensure the dialog and address bar show the correct origin and the tab doesn't have another origin's content rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Some of the PoCs benefit from behaviors described in <span class="line"><!---->Some of the PoCs benefit from behaviors described in <!----></span>issue 1196495<span class="line"><!---->issue 1196495<!----></span> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1096610<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1096610" title="External Protocol handler anti-flood protection is ineffective and flaky"><!---->issue 1096610<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but are not dependent on them for success.<span class="line"><!---->but are not dependent on them for success.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.114 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), also repros on 91.0.4468.0 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.114 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), also repros on 91.0.4468.0 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.867)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.867)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Scenario 1: Link click<span class="line"><!---->Scenario 1: Link click<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/external-protocol/spoof-links.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/external-protocol/spoof-links.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/external-protocol/spoof-links.html<!----></a><br>2. Click either of the links<span class="line"><!---->2. Click either of the links<!----></span><br><br>Observed: External protocol dialog shown with current page origin (<span class="line"><!---->Observed: External protocol dialog shown with current page origin (<!----></span>https://alesandroortiz[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz[.]com"><!---->https://alesandroortiz[.]com<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>Expected: External protocol dialog is not shown or is shown with redirecting origin (<span class="line"><!---->Expected: External protocol dialog is not shown or is shown with redirecting origin (<!----></span>https://aogarantiza[.]com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://aogarantiza[.]com"><!---->https://aogarantiza[.]com<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Scenario 2: JavaScript redirect (window.location)<span class="line"><!---->Scenario 2: JavaScript redirect (window.location)<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to one of these URLs:<span class="line"><!---->1.         Thanks for the report and the great demo videos, particularly that last one :-)<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report and the great demo videos, particularly that last one :-)<!----></span><br><br>meacer@ can you take a look a this one? Adding other c/b/external_protocol/OWNERS as well.<span class="line"><!---->meacer@ can you take a look a this one? Adding other c/b/external_protocol/OWNERS as well.<!----></span><br><br>That this (1) shows the wrong origin in the dialog, but also (2) applies the wrong permissions/content settings makes this particularly nasty. I'm tentatively setting this to Sev-Medium (because it isn't quite "full circumvention of the same origin policy" or "complete control over the apparent origin in the omnibox" for Sev-High, but it kind of feels close).<span class="line"><!---->That this (1) shows the wrong origin in the dialog, but also (2) applies the wrong permissions/content settings makes this particularly nasty. I'm tentatively setting this to Sev-Medium (because it isn't quite "full circumvention of the same origin policy" or "complete control over the apparent origin in the omnibox" for Sev-High, but it kind of feels close).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'll let external protocol OWNERS weigh in as well, but I'd assume that fixing this in Chromium will also fix this in Edge, as I've seen other external protocol handler bugs also affect Edge and I don't think they customize it much if at all downstream. In general for bug reports that affect multiple vendors, we're okay with you sending reports to each affected vendor though, but it's good for us to know if you do in case we need to coordinate disclosure.<span class="line"><!---->I'll let external protocol OWNERS weigh in as well, but I'd assume that fixing this in Chromium will also fix this in Edge, as I've seen other external protocol handler bugs also affect Edge and I don't think they customize it much if at all downstream.         I would also guess that fixing this in Chromium would fix it in Edge.<span class="line"><!---->I would also guess that fixing this in Chromium would fix it in Edge.<!----></span><br><br>This is pretty interesting.         To expand on my <span class="line"><!---->To expand on my <!----></span>comment #7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->comment #7<!----></a>, what I'm wondering is whether navigating to a URL which performs an immediate server-side redirect to an external protocol is effectively the same as the original site having a link directly embedding that external protocol. I could see that being regarded as true, which would mean this is working as intended.<span class="line"><!---->, what I'm wondering is whether navigating to a URL which performs an immediate server-side redirect to an external protocol is effectively the same as the original site having a link directly embedding that external protocol. I could see that being regarded as true, which would mean this is working as intended.<!----></span><br><br>For instance, directly navigating to <span class="line"><!---->For instance, directly navigating to <!----></span>https://aogarantiza.com/chromium/external-protocol/calc.php<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://aogarantiza.com/chromium/external-protocol/calc.php"><!---->https://aogarantiza.com/chromium/external-protocol/calc.php<!----></a> shows nothing in the omnibox, which suggests to me that no actual navigation is being committed, and all we've exchanged with the site is headers. That being said, we've exchanged at least headers with the second origin, but I don't know enough about the innards of navigation to say what we should do in this case :)<span class="line"><!----> shows nothing in the omnibox, which suggests to me that no actual navigation is being committed, and all we've exchanged with the site is headers.         > This also seems close to a cross-origin HTTP Auth dialog scenario. When an HTTP Auth dialog is shown due to a cross-origin navigation, a blank page is rendered and the omnibox shows the dialog-initiating URL.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This also seems close to a cross-origin HTTP Auth dialog scenario. When an HTTP Auth dialog is shown due to a cross-origin navigation, a blank page is rendered and the omnibox shows the dialog-initiating URL.<!----></span><br><br>Interesting observation - that seems to match the behaviour we see here where there's no committed navigation and the request initiator is still regarded as the initial origin that was navigated from.<span class="line"><!---->Interesting observation - that seems to match the behaviour we see here where there's no committed navigation and the request initiator is still regarded as the initial origin that was navigated from.<!----></span><br><br>We possibly need some navigation experts on this. +lukasza and +alexmos, can you weigh in on my questions in <span class="line"><!---->We possibly need some navigation experts on this. +lukasza and +alexmos, can you weigh in on my questions in <!----></span>comment#7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->comment#7<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>comment#8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->comment#8<!----></a>?<span class="line"><!---->?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        To clarify my comment, HTTP Auth *does* seem to commit navigation. What I meant was that external protocol handling seems similar to HTTP Auth in terms of behavior trigger (response header controls behavior) and user flow (sensitive dialog with origin info), therefore external protocol handling probably should look more like HTTP Auth flow which commits and shows origin of dialog initiator (server sending the triggering response headers).<span class="line"><!---->To clarify my comment, HTTP Auth *does* seem to commit navigation. What I meant was that external protocol handling seems similar to HTTP Auth in terms of behavior trigger (response header controls behavior) and user flow (sensitive dialog with origin info), therefore external protocol handling probably should look more like HTTP Auth flow which commits and shows origin of dialog initiator (server sending the triggering response headers).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This looks like a variant of <span class="line"><!---->This looks like a variant of <!----></span>bug 1091961<span class="line"><!---->bug 1091961<!----></span>: The navigation doesn't update content area but ends up showing some non-content area dialog, causing a mismatch between the omnibox and the dialog.<span class="line"><!---->: The navigation doesn't update content area but ends up showing some non-content area dialog, causing a mismatch between the omnibox and the dialog.<!----></span><br><br>We have many of these. Basically, anytime a navigation results in a UI (dialog, download shelf, external app opening etc) that doesn't update the omnibox, we'll have this issue. The similarity to the HTTP auth case is a great observation, and we might need to do something similar here as well.<span class="line"><!---->We have many of these. Basically, anytime a navigation results in a UI (dialog, download shelf, external app opening etc) that doesn't update the omnibox, we'll have this issue. The similarity to the HTTP auth case is a great observation, and we might need to do something similar here as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for context. Don't have access to crbug with impact details of variants in other features, but for this feature, impact seems particularly dangerous beyond origin spoof in dialog:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for context. Don't have access to crbug with impact details of variants in other features, but for this feature, impact seems particularly dangerous beyond origin spoof in dialog:<!----></span><br><br>1. An open redirect in an allowlisted origin can launch the protocol with zero interaction<span class="line"><!---->1. An open redirect in an allowlisted origin can launch the protocol with zero interaction<!----></span><br>e.g. Video conferencing site has open redirect + large % of userbase has origin+protocol allowlisted due to frequent use/enterprise policy + app has RCE vuln or other vuln via protocol handler<span class="line"><!---->e.g. Video conferencing site has open redirect + large % of userbase has origin+protocol allowlisted due to frequent use/enterprise policy + app has RCE vuln or other vuln via protocol handler<!----></span><br><br>2. Reasonably sandboxed iframe embedded by allowlisted origin can launch the protocol with zero interaction<span class="line"><!---->2. Reasonably sandboxed iframe embedded by allowlisted origin can launch the protocol with zero interaction<!----></span><br>e.g. Video conferencing site embeds 3rd party/arbitrary sandboxed iframe + user/enterprise has origin+protocol allowlisted + app has vuln via protocol handler<span class="line"><!---->e.g. Video conferencing site embeds 3rd party/arbitrary sandboxed iframe + user/enterprise has origin+protocol allowlisted + app has vuln via protocol handler<!----></span><br><br>3. Any link within allowlisted origin can launch protocol if clicked<span class="line"><!---->3. Any link within allowlisted origin can launch protocol if clicked<!----></span><br>e.g. Video conferencing site allows user-controlled HTTPS links in event descriptions, profile info, etc. + user/enterprise has origin+protocol allowlisted + app has vuln via protocol handler<span class="line"><!---->e.g. Video conferencing site allows user-controlled HTTPS links in event descriptions, profile info, etc. + user/enterprise has origin+protocol allowlisted + app has vuln via protocol handler<!----></span><br><br>If not allowlisted, only a single click in dialog is needed and it appears to be from the user-trusted website, so it's likely to be effective. There's also very few (if any) mitigations that I could find: CSP and sandboxing are largely ineffective; most websites with some type of user content allow user-controlled HTTPS links; combined with <span class="line"><!---->If not allowlisted, only a single click in dialog is needed and it appears to be from the user-trusted website, so it's likely to be effective. There's also very few (if any) mitigations that I could find: CSP and sandboxing are largely ineffective; most websites with some type of user content allow user-controlled HTTPS links; combined with <!----></span>issue 1196495<span class="line"><!---->issue 1196495<!----></span> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1096610<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1096610" title="External Protocol handler anti-flood protection is ineffective and flaky"><!---->issue 1096610<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>behaviors, it's easy to bypass protocol launch user interaction requirements for many users.<span class="line"><!---->behaviors, it's easy to bypass protocol launch user interaction requirements for many users.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1197889#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Sorry for the delay.  Let me try to answer some of the questions above (and also add the UI>Browser>Navigation component for more people to take a look).<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for the delay.  Let me try to answer some of the questions above (and also add the UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation component for more people to take a look).<!----></span><br><br>RE: external protocol handling probably should look more like HTTP Auth flow which commits<span class="line"><!---->RE: external protocol handling probably should look more like HTTP Auth flow which commits<!----></span><br><br>A navigation "commits", when a frame (e.g. content::RenderFrameImpl) will host a document.  External protocol handler doesn't create/commit a new document in a frames.<span class="line"><!---->A navigation "commits", when a frame (e.g. content::RenderFrameImpl) will host a document.  External protocol handler doesn't create/commit a new document in a frames.<!----></span><br><br>RE: External protocols in server-side redirects probably should be treated similarly to javascript: URLs in server-side redirects, which are blocked by the browser as unsafe.<span class="line"><!---->RE: External protocols in server-side redirects probably should be treated similarly to javascript: URLs in server-side redirects, which are blocked by the browser as unsafe.<!----></span><br><br>Agreed.  AFAIK we already block HTTP -> chrome-extension:// and HTTP -> file:// redirects, so this seems like definitive bug.  Let me open a separate bug for this in <span class="line"><!---->Agreed.  AFAIK we already block HTTP -&gt; chrome-extension:// and HTTP -&gt; file:// redirects, so this seems like definitive bug.  Let me open a separate bug for this in <!----></span>issue 1203814<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1203814" title="Consider blocking HTTP -> externally-handled-protocol redirects "><!---->issue 1203814<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re: <span class="line"><!---->Re: <!----></span>#c19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c19"><!---->#c19<!----></a>, that's correct, passing origin of last redirecting server should take care of dialog origin spoof in all reported scenarios.<span class="line"><!---->, that's correct, passing origin of last redirecting server should take care of dialog origin spoof in all reported scenarios.<!----></span><br><br>There's still other apparent issues, such as sandbox + CSP bypass and omnibox mismatch, but those would be moot if server-side redirect is blocked altogether (thanks for filing spinoff <span class="line"><!---->There's still other apparent issues, such as sandbox + CSP bypass and omnibox mismatch, but those would be moot if server-side redirect is blocked altogether (thanks for filing spinoff <!----></span>issue 1203814<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1203814" title="Consider blocking HTTP -> externally-handled-protocol redirects "><!---->issue 1203814<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>#c19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c19"><!---->#c19<!----></a>: I would expect the correct origin to be shown in the dialog here [here = in absence of http redirects]).<span class="line"><!---->: I would expect the correct origin to be shown in the dialog here [here = in absence of http redirects]).<!----></span><br><br>Yes, current behavior is safe for direct navigation scenarios (e.g. <a href="ms-calculator:">calc</a> or window.location = 'ms-calculator:'). The current page's origin is shown as expected. I would expect direct navigation to still be allowed, since untrusted non-HTTPS URLs can and should be blocked by websites, much like they often block direct javascript: URLs in anchor href, window.location, window.open, iframe src, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, current behavior is safe for direct navigation scenarios (e.g. &lt;a href="ms-calculator:"&gt;calc&lt;/a&gt; or window.location = 'ms-calculator:'). The current page's origin is shown as expected. I would expect direct navigation to still be allowed, since untrusted non-HTTPS URLs can and should be blocked by websites, much like they often block direct javascript: URLs in anchor href, window.location, window.open, iframe src, etc.<!----></span><br><br>Scenario 2 is for window.location navigation to a URL which returns a server-side redirect. Under the hood it's essentially the same behavior, but wanted to make it clear this repros with other common places where untrusted URLs are accepted by websites. (For reference, Scenario 2 PoC: <span class="line"><!---->Scenario 2 is for window.location navigation to a URL which returns a server-side redirect. Under the hood it's essentially the same behavior, but wanted to make it clear this repros with other common places where untrusted URLs are accepted by websites. (For reference, Scenario 2 PoC: <!----></span>https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Faogarantiza.com%2Fchromium%2Fexternal-protocol%2Fcalc.php&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AFQjCNGOqAoEa7AghaevcuD3T2XmJY62gw<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Faogarantiza.com%2Fchromium%2Fexternal-protocol%2Fcalc.php&amp;sa=D&amp;sntz=1&amp;usg=AFQjCNGOqAoEa7AghaevcuD3T2XmJY62gw"><!---->https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Faogarantiza.com%2Fchromium%2Fexternal-protocol%2Fcalc.php&amp;sa=D&amp;sntz=1&amp;usg=AFQjCNGOqAoEa7AghaevcuD3T2XmJY62gw<!----></a> )<span class="line"><!----> )<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        RE: <span class="line"><!---->RE: <!----></span>#c24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c24"><!---->#c24<!----></a>: it's not clear what origin should be the correct one to pass to the protocol handling dialog if we don't use the request_initiator<span class="line"><!---->: it's not clear what origin should be the correct one to pass to the protocol handling dialog if we don't use the request_initiator<!----></span><br><br>We've chatted offline and agreed that we should use the origin of the last redirecting server (falling back to the request_initiator if there were no redirects / if the request goes straight to an external protocol).<span class="line"><!---->We've chatted offline and agreed that we should use the origin of the last redirecting server (falling back to the request_initiator if there were no redirects / if the request goes straight to an external protocol).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97"><!---->f781748dcb3c7d0420b884c1c24b9b4497bc7c97<!----></a><br>Author: Ravjit <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ravjit &lt;<!----></span>ravjit@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ravjit@chromium.org"><!---->ravjit@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Sep 16 12:29:55 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Sep 16 12:29:55 2021<!----></span><br><br>Show the origin of the last redirecting server in external protocol handler dialogs<span class="line"><!---->Show the origin of the last redirecting server in external protocol handler dialogs<!----></span><br><br>External protocol handlers always show the initiating url's origin. This can be misleading if there are server side redirects.<span class="line"><!---->External protocol handlers always show the initiating url's origin. This can be misleading if there are server side redirects.<!----></span><br>Now we will show the origin of the last redirecting server (falling back to the request_initiator if there were no redirects / if the request goes straight to an external protocol).<span class="line"><!---->Now we will show the origin of the last redirecting server (falling back to the request_initiator if there were no redirects / if the request goes straight to an external protocol).<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1197889<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1197889"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);

          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
